Python library¶

Note that all functions are available in the top level athlib package, even though they may be defined in submodules.

athlib.normalize_gender(gender)[source]¶

Return M, F or raise a ValueError

Parameters:gender – M or F (case variations and suffixes accepted)
Returns:M or F
Raises:ValueError – raises an exception
athlib.str2num(s)[source]¶

convert string to int if possible else float

Parameters:s – string number
Returns:int(s) or float(s)
Raises:ValueError – if conversion impossible
athlib.parse_hms(t)[source]¶

Parse a time duration with 0, 1 or 2 colons and return seconds.

>>> from athlib.utils import parse_hms
>>> parse_hms('10')
10
>>> parse_hms('1:10')
70
>>> parse_hms('1:1:10')
3670
>>> parse_hms('1:1:10.1')
3670.1
>>> parse_hms(3670.1)
3670.1
athlib.get_distance(discipline)[source]¶

Return approx distance in metres, for sanity checking :param discipline: :return:

athlib.format_seconds_as_time(seconds, prec=0)[source]¶

convert seconds to a string formatted as hours:min:secs

Parameters:
  • seconds – floating point seconds
  • prec=0 – precision for seconds
Returns formatted string:
 
athlib.check_performance_for_discipline(discipline, textvalue)[source]¶

Fix up and return what they typed in, or raise ValueError

athlib.discipline_sort_key(discipline)[source]¶

Return a tuple which will sort into programme order

Track should be ordered by distance.

athlib.text_discipline_sort_key(discipline)[source]¶

Return a text version of the event_sort_key

athlib.sort_by_discipline(stuff, attr='discipline')[source]¶

Sort dicts or objects into the normal athletics order

athlib.athlon_score(gender, event_code, value)¶

Function to determine IAAF score, based on gender, event and performance.

In the interface, we assume performance is <seconds> for track events, and <metres> for throws and jumps. Ihe the Wikipedia-sourced factors, jumps are <centimetres>. Therefore there is a factor of 100 applied at the end.

athlib.athlon_performance_needed(gender, event_code, score)¶

Function to determine performance required to achieve IAAF score, given gender and event.

In the interface, we assume performance is <seconds> for track events, and <metres> for throws and jumps. Ihe the Wikipedia-sourced factors, jumps are <centimetres>. Therefore there is a factor of 100 applied at the end.

athlib.wma_age_grade(gender, age, event, performance, verbose=False)[source]¶

Return the age grade score (0 to 100ish) for this result.

athlib.wma_age_factor(gender, age, event, distance=None)[source]¶

Work out ‘slowdown factor’ for a geezer of this age taking part in this event e.g.

Codes¶

codes.JUMPS = ('HJ', 'PV', 'LJ', 'TJ')¶
codes.THROWS = ('DT', 'JT', 'HT', 'SP', 'WT')¶

codes.FIELD_SORT_ORDER = ['HJ', 'PV', 'LJ', 'TJ', 'SP', 'DT', 'HT', 'JT']¶

codes.STANDARD_FEMALE_TRACK_EVENTS = ['100', '200', '400', '800', '1500', '5000', '10000', '100H', '400H', '3000SC', '4x100', '4x400']¶
